Articles.Content:
I am not sure if this has been seen before, I have not seen it before (I have been with KSP since 0.16) and it was also not on the KSP Maps http://www.kerbalmaps.com/.

But it appears EXACTLY at 90 Latitude, 0 Longitude There is a perfect Pyramid, shining above all the other peaks around.

AS I said, this might already have been seen and recorded, and just had not been put up on the KSP Maps, or I am just blind, but yeah. Perfect Pyramid at the top of the Mun.
It's just some weirdness with the terrain generating tool near poles I presume, it's pretty much present on nearly all the planets.
Nearly every planet has these. It's a glitch, not an Easter Egg.
Ah okay, just thought it was interesting.
Easter egg, or maybe numerical artifact from the procedurally generated map (for the suspiciously exact coordinates).

But it appears EXACTLY at 90 Latitude, 0 Longitude

It's also at all the other longitudes at the same time. Blows the mind!

Sorry, couldn't resist this.
